document_data.name: One Sun
document_data.portfolio: War, knowledge, the arts, light, health
document_data.mainbody: The '''One Sun''' was a [[sun]] deity worshiped by the [[Calishite]]s under several [[:Category:Dynasties of Calimshan|dynasties]] during the [[Second Age of Calimshan|Second]] and [[Third Age of Calimshan|Third Ages of Calimshan]].
document_data.Description:
The One Sun was worshiped as the supreme head of all other gods and goddesses. The One Sun was worshiped in many guises, as a deity of light, health, war, knowledge, and the arts.

While most modern scholars of Calishite history believed, correctly, that the One Sun was an alias for many gods and goddesses collectively worshiped at that time in history, a minority held the view that the One Sun was a unique entity.
document_data.Places of Worship: Many temples to the One Sun were constructed during the [[Vahlen Dynasty]], and at least one temple to the One Sun was found in the city of [[Calimport]].
document_data.History:
Recognition of the One Sun as a deity seems to have been present as early as the reign of [[Erehnir Dynasty|Erehnir]] [[bakkal]] [[Nakkar el Erehnir IV|Nakkar IV]], who had one of the famous [[Eight Erehnirs]] of [[Volothamp]] carved in the image of a sun deity. For the most part, however, it was the Vahlen Dynasty that added the worship of the sun and sky with that of the worship of [[genie]]s begun by the Erehnirs.

400 years after the fall of the Vahlens, worship of the One Sun was taken up again by the [[Cajaan Dynasty]]

When the [[Alimir Hive]] conquered Calimshan in {{Yearlink|-1428}}, the last Cajaan ruler, [[syl-pasha]] [[Violir el Cajaan IX|Violir IX]] famously called on the One Sun to blind the [[beholder]]s and their minions with the power of light. Instead, Pasha Violir was [[Flesh to stone|petrified]] on the steps of the One Sun's temple, and Calimport and the Cajaar dynasty fell.
